intro: Osyris quadripartita, commonly known as the African waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows near water sources, showcasing its adaptability to moist environments. The plant features palmate leaves with four to six lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its showy yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, adding ornamental value. Osyris quadripartita is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
